snp4.4:1.1: “I see a pure being of ultimate wellness;
snp4.4:1.2: it is vision that grants a person purity.”
snp4.4:1.3: Recalling this notion of the ultimate,
snp4.4:1.4: they believe in the notion that there is one who observes purity.
snp4.4:2.1: If a person were granted purity through vision,
snp4.4:2.2: or if by a notion they could give up suffering,
snp4.4:2.3: then one with attachments is purified by another:
snp4.4:2.4: their view betrays them as one who asserts thus.
snp4.4:3.1: The brahmin speaks not of purity from another
snp4.4:3.2: in terms of what is seen, heard, or thought; or by precepts or vows.
snp4.4:3.3: They are unsullied in the midst of good and evil,
snp4.4:3.4: letting go what was picked up, without creating anything new here.
snp4.4:4.1: Having let go the last they lay hold of the next;
snp4.4:4.2: following impulse, they don’t get past the snare.
snp4.4:4.3: They grab on and let go like a monkey
snp4.4:5.1: Having undertaken their own vows, a person
snp4.4:5.2: visits various teachers, being attached to perception.
snp4.4:5.3: One who knows, having comprehended the truth through the knowledges,
snp4.4:5.4: does not visit various teachers, being of vast wisdom.
snp4.4:6.1: They are remote from all things
snp4.4:6.4: how could anyone in this world judge them?
snp4.4:7.1: They don’t make things up or promote them,
snp4.4:7.2: or speak of the uttermost purity.
snp4.4:7.3: After untying the tight knot of grasping
snp4.4:7.4: they long for nothing in the world.
snp4.4:8.1: The brahmin has stepped over the boundary;
snp4.4:8.2: knowing and seeing, they adopt nothing.
snp4.4:8.3: Neither in love with passion nor besotted by dispassion,
snp4.4:8.4: there is nothing here they adopt as the ultimate.
